meanings.definition: To give strength or courage to
meanings.sent1: The encouraging words from her coach helped innerve her before the race.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speech innerved the team to push harder during the game.
meanings.sent3: Her friend's silly dance moves innerved her before the big presentation.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunrise innerved her spirit for the day ahead.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt letter from her grandmother innerved her with determination.

meanings.definition: To fill with nerve or energy
meanings.sent1: The energetic music innerved the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent2: A good night's sleep can innerve you for the challenges of the day.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party innerved him so much that he jumped in shock.
meanings.sent4: The fresh mountain air seemed to innerve her very soul.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies innerved the children to come running.
